org.opends.server.api

Class ExtensibleIndexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.api.ExtensibleIndexer

  • @PublicAPI(stability=VOLATILE,
           mayInstantiate=false,
           mayExtend=true,
           mayInvoke=false)
public abstract class ExtensibleIndexer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is registered with a Backend and it provides call- backs for indexing attribute values. An index implementation will use this interface to create the keys for an attribute value.

    • Constructor Summary

      ExtensibleIndexer()

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExtensibleIndexer

        public ExtensibleIndexer()

    • Method Detail

      • getPreferredIndexName

        public abstract java.lang.String getPreferredIndexName()
        Returns the index name preferred by this indexer. This name appended with the identifier returned from getExtensibleIndexID() will be used as the index database name.
        Returns:
        The name of the index for this indexer.

      • getExtensibleIndexID

        public abstract java.lang.String getExtensibleIndexID()
        Returns an index identifier associated with this indexer. An identifier should be selected based on the matching rule type. A unique identifier will map to a unique index database in the backend implementation. If multiple matching rules need to share the index database, the corresponding indexers should always use the same identifier.
        Returns:
        index ID A String containing the ID associated with this indexer.

      • getKeys

        public abstract void getKeys(AttributeValue value,
           java.util.Set<byte[]> keys)
        Generates the set of index keys for an attribute.
        Parameters:
        value - The attribute value for which keys are required.
        keys - The set into which the generated keys will be inserted.

      • getKeys

        public abstract void getKeys(AttributeValue value,
           java.util.Map<byte[],java.lang.Boolean> modifiedKeys,
           java.lang.Boolean insert)
        Generates a map of index keys and a boolean flag indicating whether the corresponding key will be inserted or deleted.
        Parameters:
        value - The attribute for which keys are required.
        modifiedKeys - A map containing the keys and a boolean. Keys corresponding to the boolean value true should be inserted and false should be deleted.
        insert - true if generated keys should be inserted or false otherwise.
